meanings.definition: To remove from a mounting or support.
meanings.sent1: She carefully demounted the picture frame from the wall.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic is demounting the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried demounting the bird feeder for a snack.
meanings.sent4: Demounting the old habits was a challenging but necessary task.
meanings.sent5: The artist demounted the canvas to start a new painting.

meanings.definition: The act of taking apart or disassembling a structure or object.
meanings.sent1: The demounting of the old shed took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: Demounting of the furniture was necessary before moving to a new house.
meanings.sent3: The demounting of the jigsaw puzzle left a few missing pieces.
meanings.sent4: The demounting of the Lego castle was like watching a reverse construction.
meanings.sent5: The demounting of the car engine revealed the source of the problem.
